resources.string: IMPORTANT - EMERGENCY 911 REQUIRED\nTo turn on Wi-Fi Calling, enter the U.S. address where you want emergency services sent if you call 911. You can go to Settings and change this address at any time. It is very important to update this address whenever you change your location.

WARNING - EMERGENCY 911 CALL LIMITATION\nWhen calling 911, always tell the operator where you are. Your 911 call will go over Wi-Fi only if the cellular network is unavailable. 911 calls made over Wi-Fi may be delayed or unsuccessful; for example, if the 911 system doesn’t recognize the address, electrical power is out, or your Wi-Fi connection isn’t working. Emergency services will be sent to the address you provided above, so please update it as you change locations.
This may take a few moments...

We could not find the address that you entered because the street address could not be found, or the city, state, and zip code may not be correct.\n\nIf your city, state, and zip are not correct tap Edit Address, otherwise tap Save Anyway.
We could not find the address that you entered:
The address entered could not be validated by Emergency Service Providers.
Are you sure you want to use this address in case of an emergency?
The city, state, or zip code that you entered may not be correct.\n\nPlease check the address and try again.
Unable to activate Wi-Fi calling at this time.\nPlease try again later.
Unable to update the current emergency address at this time.\nPlease try again later.

Wi-Fi Calling lets you to make calls using Wi-Fi when the mobile network is not available.

To set up Wi-Fi Calling you will need to enter a US address. This address will be used by emergency services as your location if you make an emergency (E911) call over Wi-Fi from this phone within the US.

We recommend you change this address when you make calls using a different Wi-Fi network so your location information is accurate. You can change your location any time by going to Wi-Fi Calling in the Advanced Calling settings menu.
Upgrade Service to HD Voice and Video calling
Service upgraded to HD Voice and Video calling
Turn on/off HD Voice and Video Calling
Use Wi-Fi when the mobile network is not available
Video Calling is turned off.\nWould you like to turn it back on?\n
Your Video Calling Service on your account was turned off.\n\nPlease contact customer care to have the service turned on.
In order to enable wfc.\n You will fill in some information to operators:\n Address Number, Street, City, Apt, Suite, State.
